The gobby project uses an MCP tool calling system with result processing logic. A `_process_tool_proxy_result` helper function consolidates duplicate result-processing logic used by both `call_mcp_tool` (line 508) and `mcp_proxy` (line 1101) endpoints. The helper handles metrics collection, error handling (raising HTTPException(404) for missing servers), debug logging, and returns a wrapped result dict with success/result/response_time_ms fields.

The gobby project uses a task management system with CRUD operations in `/src/gobby/mcp_proxy/tools/tasks/_crud.py`. Task operations include create, read, update, delete with parent_task_id reference resolution via `resolve_task_id_for_mcp()`.

Task workflow: create/claim task first via MCP tool before making file modifications. Always verify changes by reading relevant file sections and running linting (`ruff check`) and type checking (`pyright`) before completing.

The gobby task system enforces strict commit requirements when closing tasks - it will reject task closure if there are uncommitted changes or no commits linked to the task, even with skip_validation flags. If a user requests work without asking for commits, the task should be left open rather than attempting to force closure.
